official_procedure: Submit written application to warden 3 days prior
real_procedure: Usually you just have to go to warden's office with a hostel leave application and that's all your work done after he signs your letter

official_procedure: Apply via Academic Services portal and submit documents
real_procedure: Processing often takes 3â€“4 days longer than stated and it can be faster if you personally go to PhD section of college and talk to the sir there
Office visit speeds up refund process
Go to College's T&P Cell and they will give you NOC with ease

official_procedure: Submit application online through Scholarship Portal; verification handled by administration
real_procedure: In reality, you need to go to the PhD section for document verification, which makes the process faster

official_procedure: Submit medical leave application to HOD along with medical certificate
real_procedure: Usually just give the certificate to your professor; if they ask, get hospital verification, otherwise they accept it and mark you present

official_procedure: Return all borrowed books and pay pending fines before clearance
real_procedure: Most times, if you know the librarian, they clear your record quickly even if small fines are pending

official_procedure: Apply through ERP portal within 7 days of result declaration
real_procedure: Going directly to the exam cell speeds up the process and ensures your application is noticed

official_procedure: Submit request form at administration office with old ID card missing FIR from police
real_procedure: In practice, just visit the Library, explain the issue, and they print a new card immediately after

official_procedure: if there is some issue regarding result card like missprint or wrong info write a mail to esamarth official email
real_procedure: In Practice go to Esamarth office in CSC Centre and tell them your issue they will fix that as soon as possible no need to wait after writing email
